commit_message:
tempest: Don't hardcode external network id

Not all environments call the external network "public".
There is already a tempest config option called "nic_id"
which can be used to name the external network.
Use this option.

Change-Id: I562f4cf548817325fbf613e9c8cc51fe51b3b3a1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-08 16:42:25.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/connector.py'], 'message': "Not-For-Merge: connector.py: Log 'connection_info'

This is to debug a Volume-based live migration bug[1] that is throwing
iSCSI related errors.

There's a suspicion that it is due to both source and destination using
_same_ iSCSI 'InitiatorName'.  Let's try to explicitly log the iSCSI
InitiatorName.

Thanks Lee Yarwood for the pointer.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1524898 --
    Volume based live migration aborted unexpectedly

Change-Id: I9f127f98b8d8f982caaab68734fef37478620984
"}]
commit_message:
Not-For-Merge: connector.py: Log 'connection_info'

This is to debug a Volume-based live migration bug[1] that is throwing
iSCSI related errors.

There's a suspicion that it is due to both source and destination using
_same_ iSCSI 'InitiatorName'.  Let's try to explicitly log the iSCSI
InitiatorName.

Thanks Lee Yarwood for the pointer.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1524898 --
    Volume based live migration aborted unexpectedly

Change-Id: I9f127f98b8d8f982caaab68734fef37478620984

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-04 07:50:26.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_cli.py', 'fuelweb_test/settings.py'], 'message': "Fix for test on deployment env via cli

Added interface updating after adding compute/controller and before
provisioning for test on creation and deployment environment using Fuel
CLI.
Also running ha and sanity OSTF tests was replaced with
assert_os_services_ready and assert_ha_services_ready calls as we
should wait for services availability before running OSTF tests.
And these functions use running ha and sanity OSTF tests so that
we don't have to call it again.
Code was partly back-ported from master branch.

Change-Id: Id1ac7a0a38465360e37834fe26d8970b29226977
Closes-Bug: #1589942
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for test on deployment env via cli

Added interface updating after adding compute/controller and before
provisioning for test on creation and deployment environment using Fuel
CLI.
Also running ha and sanity OSTF tests was replaced with
assert_os_services_ready and assert_ha_services_ready calls as we
should wait for services availability before running OSTF tests.
And these functions use running ha and sanity OSTF tests so that
we don't have to call it again.
Code was partly back-ported from master branch.

Change-Id: Id1ac7a0a38465360e37834fe26d8970b29226977
Closes-Bug: #1589942

commit_message:
Fix utility print_executions method

* Printing task executions should be in TX so that SQLAlchemy session
  is alive while we're entities related to root objects (wf execution).
  Otherwise, lazy loading doesn't work.

Closes-Bug: #1599918
Change-Id: Id27dee11fe746c4cb9cce08c6fd151d7317e4b9b

commit_message:
Location strategy config shouldn't be ristricted

The idea of location strategy is allowing cloud provider can add a
customized location strategy. That said, no code change should be
involved. But seems it's not true for this case. So need remove
choices from Config option location_strategy.

Closes-Bug: #1598282
Change-Id: Ifde71056c37e2da8f21662d06841a9b5cabb3f48

subject: Improve validation for some functions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-08 08:59:59.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'heat/tests/test_translation_rule.py', 'heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/engine/translation.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': "Improve validation for some functions

Move validation code to __init__ method for these list of
functions: Removed, Repeat, Yaql, so now validation error will
be found during template.parse() and returned with a path
to the function in template. Don't change validation for
GetAttr, because it resolves some arguments and we need to parse
template before we can use resolve().
Also, remove check for Removed function in translation, because
now we can't have Removed in properties.

Change-Id: I4f2e1ebee37e82badcdca9110cadc649aa01be8c
"}]
commit_message:
Improve validation for some functions

Move validation code to __init__ method for these list of
functions: Removed, Repeat, Yaql, so now validation error will
be found during template.parse() and returned with a path
to the function in template. Don't change validation for
GetAttr, because it resolves some arguments and we need to parse
template before we can use resolve().
Also, remove check for Removed function in translation, because
now we can't have Removed in properties.

Change-Id: I4f2e1ebee37e82badcdca9110cadc649aa01be8c

subject: Add proper error handling for task continuation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 08:13:26.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/engine/actions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_error_handling.py', 'mistral/engine/policies.py'], 'message': "Add proper error handling for task continuation

* In case if task needs to be continued, e.g. in case of 'wait-before'
  policy which inserts a delay into normal task execution flow (between
  creation of task policy and scheduling actions), possible exceptions
  also need to be handled properly (move task and worklfow into ERROR).
  This patch adds error handling and the test to check this.
* Other minor changes related to addressing a few TODO's across engine
  code.

Change-Id: I525f193a149e3b0341aa8d0ffa0858ded96ba94f
"}]
commit_message:
Add proper error handling for task continuation

* In case if task needs to be continued, e.g. in case of 'wait-before'
  policy which inserts a delay into normal task execution flow (between
  creation of task policy and scheduling actions), possible exceptions
  also need to be handled properly (move task and worklfow into ERROR).
  This patch adds error handling and the test to check this.
* Other minor changes related to addressing a few TODO's across engine
  code.

Change-Id: I525f193a149e3b0341aa8d0ffa0858ded96ba94f

subject: Do not populate unused stack and watch rule objects
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-10 22:12:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/objects/watch_rule.py', 'heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/objects/watch_data.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Do not populate unused stack and watch rule objects

These fields are lazy loaded, so cause extra unnecessary database
access.

The watch rules are needed when formatting every watch data metric for
the cloudwatch API, so an id->name map of all rules is built to avoid
repeated lazy loading of every rule.

Change-Id: I36dd43172ccd402f08a45b254ae47e208b7b8c08
Related-Bug: #1479723
'}]
commit_message:
Do not populate unused stack and watch rule objects

These fields are lazy loaded, so cause extra unnecessary database
access.

The watch rules are needed when formatting every watch data metric for
the cloudwatch API, so an id->name map of all rules is built to avoid
repeated lazy loading of every rule.

Change-Id: I36dd43172ccd402f08a45b254ae47e208b7b8c08
Related-Bug: #1479723

subject: Use local.conf instead of localrc in devstack configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-26 08:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'test-functions.sh', 'devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh', 'functions.sh'], 'message': "Use local.conf instead of localrc in devstack configuration

local.conf can include all options while there are some options can't
be defined by localrc
So we should use local.conf rather than localrc to configure openstack
in devstack. This change is the first step to provide configuration
by local.conf.

- Add DEVSTACK_GATE_LOCALCONF to specify a path of local file that store
  options to update local.conf.
- Merge a local.conf file specified by DEVSTACK_GATE_LOCALCONF to
  a source local.conf file.
  Add functions to add and update a key in the source local.conf.

This change doesn't yet support grenade mode and multinode.

Change-Id: I7b0344083c90013cecab5a706e6a3d98bba947af
"}]
commit_message:
Use local.conf instead of localrc in devstack configuration

local.conf can include all options while there are some options can't
be defined by localrc
So we should use local.conf rather than localrc to configure openstack
in devstack. This change is the first step to provide configuration
by local.conf.

- Add DEVSTACK_GATE_LOCALCONF to specify a path of local file that store
  options to update local.conf.
- Merge a local.conf file specified by DEVSTACK_GATE_LOCALCONF to
  a source local.conf file.
  Add functions to add and update a key in the source local.conf.

This change doesn't yet support grenade mode and multinode.

Change-Id: I7b0344083c90013cecab5a706e6a3d98bba947af

commit_message:
Mapping power_state from integer to string

To improve user experience, mapping an integer code of power state to
real string.

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].

Change-Id: Ie11d207d187660b8d5b1aef4a23b469493102aa4

commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: Ie11d207d187660b8d5b1aef4a23b469493102aa4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-06 11:14:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/notifiers/nova.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_nova.py'], 'message': "When deleting floating IP catch PortNotFound

If we try to delete a VM and to delete the floating IP
associated with the VM at the same time, depending
on the order according to which these requests are processed
Neutron might fail in the deletion of the floating IP,
raising a PortNotFound error. This happens because Neutron
notifies Nova of the network change event and it tries to get
the port to which the FIP is associated. If the port is not there,
Neutron shouldn't raise, it shouldn't send any notification.

Change-Id: Ic72313ad1f787b3cb528e806c843f1fd01eb12f2
Closes-bug: #1586931
"}]
commit_message:
When deleting floating IP catch PortNotFound

If we try to delete a VM and to delete the floating IP
associated with the VM at the same time, depending
on the order according to which these requests are processed
Neutron might fail in the deletion of the floating IP,
raising a PortNotFound error. This happens because Neutron
notifies Nova of the network change event and it tries to get
the port to which the FIP is associated. If the port is not there,
Neutron shouldn't raise, it shouldn't send any notification.

Change-Id: Ic72313ad1f787b3cb528e806c843f1fd01eb12f2
Closes-bug: #1586931

commit_message:
Add LDAP support to keystone Dockerfile

Currently, the keystone docker image doesn't support LDAP/AD
which is a common to manage users and group for identity
management and authentication.

This change adds ldappool to the builds.

Change-Id: Ida5a58f6c57cd173642f0a801dc9ecd84ded55e8
Closes-Bug: #1600586
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints in tox installs

The tox targets do not currently use upper constaints, resulting in
stable branch test runs pulling down newer library versions than what
should be supported for those releases.

This adds upper-constaints for test environment setup.

Change-Id: I1ff164242901a891fb45da03b1595b2e9246a765
Closes-bug: #1596246
(cherry picked from commit c9e1a1aabc0ffb4b60b9327916ab9a65df98087a)

the CirrOS images and some OpenStack configuration files (always needed

Change-Id: I3b09ddaed4f1e92bf2ffc2990254e65276c32541

commit_message:
Split apt_pre-download.sh script

This patch splits apt_pre-download.sh into two files: one for download
the CirrOS images and some OpenStack configuration files (always needed
and not distro-specific) and another one for downloading packages (which
is distro-specific and not necessary if a node is built without using
a basedisk).

Change-Id: I3b09ddaed4f1e92bf2ffc2990254e65276c32541

addition to showing number of bytes.

E.g.:

```
$ glance-replicator size az3:9292 --token $SECONDARY_AUTH_TOKEN
```

commit_message:
replicator: size: Display human-readable size

Display a nice, human-readable size (e.g.: gibibytes, mebibytes, etc.) in
addition to showing number of bytes.

E.g.:

```
$ glance-replicator size az3:9292 --token $SECONDARY_AUTH_TOKEN
Total size is 39022543360 bytes (36.3 GiB) across 20 images
```

Closes-Bug: #1599192

Change-Id: I140df511128c03f5f58bcffdd015b63248519738

commit_message:
Fix nova host-evacuate for v2.14

From API micro version 2.14, evacuate does not need onSharedStorage
flag. This patch check the API micro version and set/ignore the
onSharedStorage flag before call evacuate for each instance.

Closes-Bug: #1581336
Change-Id: I825653d66f94d36a945b8240ec52285827423375
(cherry picked from commit fc90f825f478ac20762c30ec2c84d538acb3ea84)

subject: Add preseed-ssh-v3.cfg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-10 11:54:07.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/netboot/preseed-ssh-v3.cfg'], 'message': 'Add preseed-ssh-v3.cfg

The new pressed file, preseed-ssh-v3.cfg, selects /dev/sda as the disk
to partition. This is not required for current basedisk builds (because
there is only ever one disk), but it is necessary for installation with
multiple disks (for instance PXE booting on nodes with a second disk
for storage).

The change should not break current installations, but adding a new
file keeps the old files around in case there is ever any doubt.

The new file also documents how to halt after installation (something
we might want to do in the future).

Change-Id: If291d1f223e56d7f76e7602a0db27687e82676f4
'}]
commit_message:
Add preseed-ssh-v3.cfg

The new pressed file, preseed-ssh-v3.cfg, selects /dev/sda as the disk
to partition. This is not required for current basedisk builds (because
there is only ever one disk), but it is necessary for installation with
multiple disks (for instance PXE booting on nodes with a second disk
for storage).

The change should not break current installations, but adding a new
file keeps the old files around in case there is ever any doubt.

The new file also documents how to halt after installation (something
we might want to do in the future).

Change-Id: If291d1f223e56d7f76e7602a0db27687e82676f4

commit_message:
fix do_interactive_update output resource event.

revisions:

The comment above _vm_boot_with_autostart claims that the function
waits until the VM is shut down, which is incorrect. It only waits

Change-Id: I16276571c77444c7354b5aa387cdc53ab915c746
'}]
commit_message:
Fix comment about _vm_boot_with_autostart

The comment above _vm_boot_with_autostart claims that the function
waits until the VM is shut down, which is incorrect. It only waits
for the end of autostart files processing.

Change-Id: I16276571c77444c7354b5aa387cdc53ab915c746

subject: Prints  '-' instead of 'None' when data is None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-10 06:00:07.000000000', 'files': ['saharaclient/tests/unit/nova/test_shell.py', 'saharaclient/openstack/common/cliutils.py'], 'message': "Prints  '-' instead of 'None' when data is None

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is  different
to None. To clear the confusion, Client should print '-' instead of
'None' when data is None. Nova Client and Cinder Client has cleared
the confusion.

Change-Id: I57d60156b40c0684faded475adfd695108dc123e
Related-Bug: #1266414
Related-Bug: #1422244
Related-Bug: #1600553
"}]
commit_message:
Prints  '-' instead of 'None' when data is None

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is  different
to None. To clear the confusion, Client should print '-' instead of
'None' when data is None. Nova Client and Cinder Client has cleared
the confusion.

Change-Id: I57d60156b40c0684faded475adfd695108dc123e
Related-Bug: #1266414
Related-Bug: #1422244
Related-Bug: #1600553

commit_message:
Prints  '-' instead of 'None' when data is None

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is  different
to None. To clear the confusion, Client should print '-' instead of
'None' when data is None. Nova Client and Cinder Client has cleared
the confusion.

Change-Id: I6aa85bca65e5b6ec8a00885f9c2df06554b509f6
Related-Bug: #1266414
Related-Bug: #1422244
Related-Bug: #1600553

commit_message:
Add Angular Senlin Receivers Table use registry

We will replace the current receiver panel with angular panel
while we implement the angular receiver table:-)

To be added in subsequent patches:
 - Detail Table
 - Actions
 - filterFacets
 - Integration to Searchlight

To Test
 - add panel `ngreceivers` in senlin_dashboard/cluster/dashboard.py

Change-Id: I515a717aa02b87e9bfd3985c3422065a3bbfe50e
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-receiver-table

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-08 09:04:20.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/tests/unit/common/test_http.py'], 'message': "Fix py35 unit tests

String representation of http_lib' status code differs in python 3.5
from previous versions, so remove error's string asserts.

Also two tests that validate error message and traceback were removed.

Closes-Bug: #1599796
Change-Id: Iacd26f01d93457e1026ca905f5fdad3dc809c74b

commit_message:
Fix py35 unit tests

String representation of http_lib' status code differs in python 3.5
from previous versions, so remove error's string asserts.

Also two tests that validate error message and traceback were removed.

Closes-Bug: #1599796
Change-Id: Iacd26f01d93457e1026ca905f5fdad3dc809c74b

subject: Bump gabbi version to recent release 1.24.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-07 20:41:33.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Bump gabbi version to recent release 1.24.0

1.24.0 adds support for matching a jsonpath result as a regular
expression. This is handy when the result is a UUID, which is
rather common in OpenStack APIs. In this case, the particular
place where the feature will be useful is in tests for the
placement API in Change Icb9c8f7a1fa8a9eac66c2d72f4b7e4efd4e1944f.

Change-Id: Ibee53862d2225014f22a780237832c23effd38db
'}]
commit_message:
Bump gabbi version to recent release 1.24.0

1.24.0 adds support for matching a jsonpath result as a regular
expression. This is handy when the result is a UUID, which is
rather common in OpenStack APIs. In this case, the particular
place where the feature will be useful is in tests for the
placement API in Change Icb9c8f7a1fa8a9eac66c2d72f4b7e4efd4e1944f.

Change-Id: Ibee53862d2225014f22a780237832c23effd38db

commit_message:
Add nova-manage quota_usage_refresh command

This is the final patch in the sequence.

The nova-manage quota_usage_refresh command will
sync a project or user's usage in the database
with the actual usage.

Implements blueprint: refresh-quotas-usage

Change-Id: Ic6da10b9c567ad5396b4a22b160e1abef8fa8f28

subject: Remove unnecessary stable attribute value for status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-09 15:27:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/resource/routers.py'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary stable attribute value for status

Most routers do not explicitly set the status attribute to
stable since this is the default. To maintain code
consistency with the other routers the setting of the
status attribute to a value of stable has been removed.

Change-Id: I5dd8827b95f1d73b3c6b6b489ec6cdb947e67bca
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary stable attribute value for status

Most routers do not explicitly set the status attribute to
stable since this is the default. To maintain code
consistency with the other routers the setting of the
status attribute to a value of stable has been removed.

Change-Id: I5dd8827b95f1d73b3c6b6b489ec6cdb947e67bca

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

when an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments.

Change-Id: Ie7905e47e91547601ae78abf3a6e135a0f8ac2d6

subject: Do not create default network
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-08 07:29:50.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf.sample', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Do not create default network

1. What is the problem
In the current file /tricircle/devstack/local.conf.sample,
Devstack will create initial network elements including
external network. However, this configuration sample for one
node doesn't support external network. If it runs on a single
node then some errors will turn up.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Adding a new line in /tricircle/devstack/local.conf.sample
at the place before we manually set our own network. The
content of the new line is "NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS
=False".

Change-Id: I9998df946f121858f664f9b2e56eda463f014c30
'}]
commit_message:
Do not create default network

1. What is the problem
In the current file /tricircle/devstack/local.conf.sample,
Devstack will create initial network elements including
external network. However, this configuration sample for one
node doesn't support external network. If it runs on a single
node then some errors will turn up.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Adding a new line in /tricircle/devstack/local.conf.sample
at the place before we manually set our own network. The
content of the new line is "NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS
=False".

Change-Id: I9998df946f121858f664f9b2e56eda463f014c30

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6802, 'name': 'Joel Coffman', 'email': 'jmc7tp@gmail.com', 'username': 'joel-coffman'}, {'_account_id': 7764, 'name': 'Peter Hamilton', 'email': 'peter.hamilton@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'Peter'}, {'_account_id': 7789, 'name': 'John Wood', 'email': 'john.wood@rackspace.com', 'username': 'woodster'}, {'_account_id': 8623, 'name': 'Kaitlin Farr', 'email': 'kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'kaitlin.farr'}, {'_account_id': 11131, 'name': 'OpenStack Proposal Bot', 'username': 'proposal-bot', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16046, 'name': 'Fernando Diaz', 'email': 'diazjf@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'diazjf'}, {'_account_id': 18623, 'name': 'Pankaj Khandar', 'email': 'pankaj.khandar@gmail.com', 'username': 'Pan'}, {'_account_id': 21797, 'name': 'liujiong', 'display_name': 'Jeremy Liu', 'email': 'liujiong.cc@gmail.com', 'username': 'liujiong'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-07-07 22:14:59.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py', 'barbican/plugin/kmip_secret_store.py'], 'message': 'Insecure default PROTOCOL_TLSv1 version in KMIP plugin

The default TLSv1 protocol version used by the KMIP plugin is insecure.
This can cause potential information disclosure by attacking connections
using vulnerable TLS protocols. This change will use TLSv1_2 if present.

Change-Id: I7018262cb74a95dfa24d6b94d49f1ebd62bdeebd
'}]
commit_message:
Insecure default PROTOCOL_TLSv1 version in KMIP plugin

The default TLSv1 protocol version used by the KMIP plugin is insecure.
This can cause potential information disclosure by attacking connections
using vulnerable TLS protocols. This change will use TLSv1_2 if present.

Change-Id: I7018262cb74a95dfa24d6b94d49f1ebd62bdeebd

subject: Change pip install task state to 'latest'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-09 14:11:37.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_install.yml'], 'message': "Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Related-Bug: 1596620

Change-Id: I90a044e142829ea90bbc81cdda5a2a257fe8de22
(cherry picked from commit ac3bbca051c5b87ddbe7cc1a477be013b0669f12)
"}]
commit_message:
Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Related-Bug: 1596620

Change-Id: I90a044e142829ea90bbc81cdda5a2a257fe8de22
(cherry picked from commit ac3bbca051c5b87ddbe7cc1a477be013b0669f12)

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In

commit_message:
Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Related-Bug: 1596620

Change-Id: Idb3f0c0ff8468eec330b4b39dcce567af0b1f9ef
(cherry picked from commit dee286cb9498d2f4bd13c84d99159346eb7999e5)

commit_message:
Underline should match the title length in docs

According to the openstack contributer guide, the underlines
in an rst file should be of the same length as that of the
heading text to follow rst formatting conventions.
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/rst-conv/titles.html

Change-Id: I186abdfd87bc1e26fb822412b7335b1c42c25b25
Signed-off-by: Asha Saravanamohan <assarava@cisco.com>

subject: Change pip install task state to 'latest'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-09 14:20:13.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_client_install.yml'], 'message': "Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Related-Bug: 1596620

Change-Id: I320a4b8c1876cec12e85985288f084f7396e459b
(cherry picked from commit 14590f23eae9f826b1a82ae7d3fffb7de8207b13)
"}]
commit_message:
Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Related-Bug: 1596620

Change-Id: I320a4b8c1876cec12e85985288f084f7396e459b
(cherry picked from commit 14590f23eae9f826b1a82ae7d3fffb7de8207b13)

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-06-22 23:03:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/callbacks/manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/callbacks/test_manager.py', 'neutron/db/api.py'], 'message': "Separate exception class for retriables in callbacks

There are various places where we emit a callback to allow
subscribers to do validation or additional bookkeeping during
the various life-cycle events of objects. However, a subscriber
can encounter a DB Deadlock, StaleDataError or other retriable
error that just needs the transaction to be restarted. In the
rest of the Neutron code these exceptions bubble up to the API
layer where the whole request is restarted. However, the exception
catching for the callbacks in various places was preventing these
errors from being retried because they were lost in conversion.

This patch has the callback manager convert retriable exceptions
into RetryRequest exceptions that will not be caught by handlers
of CallbackError so by default it will bubble up to the API layer
and be retried. 'notify' callers can avoid this behavior by
additionally catching RetryRequest.

Closes-Bug: #1590316
Change-Id: I6732c60f89de4318b5f56327c5bc966bd250baae
"}]
commit_message:
Separate exception class for retriables in callbacks

There are various places where we emit a callback to allow
subscribers to do validation or additional bookkeeping during
the various life-cycle events of objects. However, a subscriber
can encounter a DB Deadlock, StaleDataError or other retriable
error that just needs the transaction to be restarted. In the
rest of the Neutron code these exceptions bubble up to the API
layer where the whole request is restarted. However, the exception
catching for the callbacks in various places was preventing these
errors from being retried because they were lost in conversion.

This patch has the callback manager convert retriable exceptions
into RetryRequest exceptions that will not be caught by handlers
of CallbackError so by default it will bubble up to the API layer
and be retried. 'notify' callers can avoid this behavior by
additionally catching RetryRequest.

Closes-Bug: #1590316
Change-Id: I6732c60f89de4318b5f56327c5bc966bd250baae

commit_message:
Handle catalog backends that don't support all functions.

Using the templated backend for catalogs deleting a project
will currently work but it will return an error to the user
that is raised in the delete notification code handling.

Change-Id: Ie2ecb226389a7ee74dc64b28b0e08817e6375801
Closes-Bug: #1579604
(cherry picked from commit 8232f4f23c1c33a6e45073386f40e79139d9b980)

commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] Add configuration parameters for send message deadline

This patch add driver configuration option parameters for oslo_messaging_amqp
reply, send and notification timeout. These timeouts are used when the caller
does not provide a timeout expiry.

Change-Id: I398a4686abf3df6e5c802d94d6bda7ba9995833d
Depends-On: I6b60b6944a4c44da9b2e41ab2a83ab59f15e396e
Closes-Bug: #1596641

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 8601, 'name': 'Dmitriy Ukhlov', 'email': 'dukhlov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dukhlov'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 9257, 'name': 'John Eckersberg', 'email': 'jeckersb@redhat.com', 'username': 'jeckersb'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}, {'_account_id': 20523, 'name': 'Andy Smith', 'email': 'ansmith@redhat.com', 'username': 'ajssmith'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-06 14:43:44.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/opts.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/addressing.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/eventloop.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_amqp_driver.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/controller.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_amqp1.py'], 'message': 'Re-factor the AMQP 1.0 addressing semantics

This patch introduces a new routable addressing format.  This new
address format not only works with traditional broker-based messaging
backends but can be used to optimally route messages across a mesh
messaging topology.  This new addressing format may be enabled either
via configuration or by message bus identification.

This patch moves all of the AMQP 1.0 addressing logic into a new
Addresser class.  This class is used to map an oslo.messaging Target
address and notification flag into a corresponding AMQP 1.0
message/subscription address based on the addressing mode.  This hides
the addressing details from the rest of the driver.

For backward compatibility with previous releases the Addresser can be
configured to automatically detect a non-routable messaging back end
and fall back to using the legacy addressing scheme.

The intention is to use routable addressing as the only form of
addressing supported by the driver regardless of messaging back end.
However before that can happen the legacy addressing must follow the
standard deprecation process.  Until then legacy addressing will
remain available for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I6b60b6944a4c44da9b2e41ab2a83ab59f15e396e
'}]
commit_message:
Re-factor the AMQP 1.0 addressing semantics

This patch introduces a new routable addressing format.  This new
address format not only works with traditional broker-based messaging
backends but can be used to optimally route messages across a mesh
messaging topology.  This new addressing format may be enabled either
via configuration or by message bus identification.

This patch moves all of the AMQP 1.0 addressing logic into a new
Addresser class.  This class is used to map an oslo.messaging Target
address and notification flag into a corresponding AMQP 1.0
message/subscription address based on the addressing mode.  This hides
the addressing details from the rest of the driver.

For backward compatibility with previous releases the Addresser can be
configured to automatically detect a non-routable messaging back end
and fall back to using the legacy addressing scheme.

The intention is to use routable addressing as the only form of
addressing supported by the driver regardless of messaging back end.
However before that can happen the legacy addressing must follow the
standard deprecation process.  Until then legacy addressing will
remain available for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I6b60b6944a4c44da9b2e41ab2a83ab59f15e396e

in Ocata.

commit_message:
RBD: uppercase rbd_opts for consistency

Since the options variable is a constant, it's more consistent with
Python's style guide to make it uppercase.

See: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#constants

Change-Id: I172dc66d4073e381e20f7aed9fdeaf81ff4fa52e

subject: puppet-ceph: move puppet4 jobs into p-o-i
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 15:34:05.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "puppet-ceph: move puppet4 jobs into p-o-i

Like other Puppet OpenStack modules, run puppet4 jobs as -nv in
puppet-openstack-integration so we don't run it in puppet-ceph check
pipeline. When we'll decide that Puppet4 is stable for us, we'll switch
every Puppet4 job to the gate but it's not the case yet.

Change-Id: I121d4b72d8e64ee136ecd5e095baa7e45c8f9eaa
"}]
commit_message:
puppet-ceph: move puppet4 jobs into p-o-i

Like other Puppet OpenStack modules, run puppet4 jobs as -nv in
puppet-openstack-integration so we don't run it in puppet-ceph check
pipeline. When we'll decide that Puppet4 is stable for us, we'll switch
every Puppet4 job to the gate but it's not the case yet.

Change-Id: I121d4b72d8e64ee136ecd5e095baa7e45c8f9eaa

subject: Fix devstack bash tools
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-08 16:08:32.000000000', 'files': ['murano-ci/config/devstack/post-unstack.sh', 'murano-ci/tools/split-logs.sh', 'murano-ci/tools/rotate-devstack-logs.sh'], 'message': 'Fix devstack bash tools

This commit is the first one in series of commits, which are changing
bash scripts of murano-deployment so they can pass shellcheck in
gate-murano-deployment job.
This commit fixes tools related to devstack host setup and administration.
Additional change:
  - logs names pattern is updated in rotate-devstack-logs.sh
  - now rotate-devstack-logs.sh rotates all logs except stack.sh log

Partial-Bug: #1600213
Change-Id: I12a747dbb981486ae51cecaefe71a226cf7c994d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix devstack bash tools

This commit is the first one in series of commits, which are changing
bash scripts of murano-deployment so they can pass shellcheck in
gate-murano-deployment job.
This commit fixes tools related to devstack host setup and administration.
Additional change:
  - logs names pattern is updated in rotate-devstack-logs.sh
  - now rotate-devstack-logs.sh rotates all logs except stack.sh log

Partial-Bug: #1600213
Change-Id: I12a747dbb981486ae51cecaefe71a226cf7c994d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-07 15:18:11.000000000', 'files': ['designate_tempest_plugin/tests/api/v2/test_recordset.py'], 'message': "Reuse zone during recordset tests

commit_message:
Reuse zone during recordset tests

There's no need to create a new zone for each and every recordset test,
instead, we create a single zone for each test class and reuse for all
the tests contained within that class.

Change-Id: I3e1e9b889542e742adff412962206972de7e7e16

subject: Change pip install task state to 'latest'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-04 08:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_client_install.yml'], 'message': "Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Change-Id: I320a4b8c1876cec12e85985288f084f7396e459b
"}]
commit_message:
Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Change-Id: I320a4b8c1876cec12e85985288f084f7396e459b

upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Change-Id: Iebff3c8e9d215898ee07632c101931910327a52e

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-08 03:27:28.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/pollsters/memory.py', 'ceilometer/compute/virt/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/compute/virt/libvirt/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/compute/virt/libvirt/test_inspector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/compute/pollsters/test_memory.py'], 'message': 'throw PollsterPermenantError exception for memory usage meter

For memory usage meter, if it is not supported by libvirt and the
underlying hypervisor being used by libvirt, there is no meaning
to running the pollster again and again and so we should throw
PollsterPermenantError exception, like what l3 cache meter does.

Change-Id: I871841f2ce8f755bdeb2aff3fb063158b5c0650a
Closes-Bug: 1599344
'}]
commit_message:
throw PollsterPermenantError exception for memory usage meter

For memory usage meter, if it is not supported by libvirt and the
underlying hypervisor being used by libvirt, there is no meaning
to running the pollster again and again and so we should throw
PollsterPermenantError exception, like what l3 cache meter does.

Change-Id: I871841f2ce8f755bdeb2aff3fb063158b5c0650a
Closes-Bug: 1599344

commit_message:
base.Resource not define __ne__() built-in function

Class base.Resource defines __eq__() built-in function, but does
not define __ne__() built-in function, so self.assertEqual works
but self.assertNotEqual does not work at all in this test case in
python2. This patch fixes it by defining __ne__() built-in function
of class base.Resource. Also fixes spelling errors:resoruces.

Change-Id: I39e6f6b94e9490afc14143208e6f20b0ef960991
Closes-Bug: #1586268
